messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Lots of Input
messages.msgSnippet: ... discussions - of ... older, etc. HOW we understand to apply unschooling principles when it isn t as simple/easy to see - those insights are going to be
messages.messageBody:
>My answer is that, yes, I'd like to see those
discussions - of
>sensitive, gifted, autistic, minority, very young,
older, etc. >HOW we understand to apply unschooling
principles when it isn't >as simple/easy to see -
those insights are going to be very >valuable to all
of us.
>-pam

Oh, I so agree Pam! That's one reason I tend to stick
to a broader list like this one for unschooling
support, because I personally really thrive on
diversity of input. It's sometimes usefull and
reassuring to drop in to a more specific list for kids
with special needs, just to read or to ask specific
questions that those folks would have experience with.
But for general input and sharing, I have yet to find
a list that beats Alwayslearning.

Nanci K.
